alert.note: Alert for Petersburg Borough (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 21 at 5:23PM AKST until January 22 at 12:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW ACROSS THE CENTRAL PANHANDLE... .Snowfall rates have increased across the central panhandle through Sunday morning with higher ratios. This resulted in the onset time to begin earlier, a longer duration snowfall, and thus higher total accumulations. Dry snow will become wetter through the event with southern areas transitioning to rain. For northern areas, it is possible that snow lasts longer Monday night. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT AKST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Wet snow and freezing rain. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches. Ice accumulation one tenth of an inch or less. * WHERE...Petersburg Borough. * WHEN...Until midnight AKST tonight. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. Horizontal surfaces may become very slippery under a thin glaze of ice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow is expected to increase in water content through the duration of the event.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. People are urged to prepare their property before the onset of winter weather. For the latest road conditions, where available, call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
